en: Computers are really selling like hotcakes.
It is an advantage to be able to use a computer.
ko: 컴퓨터를 쓸 줄 아는 건 큰 장점이야.

en: Computers have changed the industrial picture considerably.
My computer is out of order, and I have to get it repaired.
ko: 컴퓨터가 고장 나서 수리 맡겨야 돼.

en: The computer broke down.
Computers are being introduced into this company.
There is a labor shortage of computer programmers.
The computer system shuts down automatically at 8pm.
I am able to buy anything in a convenience store.
ko: 편의점에선 뭐든 다 살 수 있어.

en: Hi, George! How's it going?
I'd like to drive across the USA in a convertible car.
ko: 오픈카 타고 미국 횡단해 보고 싶어.

en: Hi! I'm Ichirou Tanaka. Nice to meet you.
ko: 안녕! 난 다나카 이치로라고 해. 만나서 반가워.

en: Hi! Thanks for flying with us. How are you today?
ko: 안녕하세요! 저희 항공 이용해 주셔서 감사해요. 오늘 좀 어떠세요?

en: Hi! What is the purpose of your visit in America, sir?
ko: 안녕하세요! 미국 방문 목적이 어떻게 되시나요?

en: Good day. How are you today?
Hi, Roger. I'm pretty good!
ko: 안녕, 로저. 나 아주 잘 지내!

en: Hi, Mimi! How are you doing?
Hi, my name is Ken Saitou.
Hi, Paul. Busy as usual?
Hello, Tom.
Hi, Susan. How are you?
Hello. Are you Jackie Scott?
Hi, how are you, everyone?
Hi! Do you work here?
Such extravagance is beyond my reach.
ko: 그런 사치는 내가 감당할 수 있는 게 아니야.

en: I have no idea what he has in mind, rejecting such a favorable proposal.
ko: 그렇게 좋은 제안을 거절하다니 걔가 무슨 생각인지 모르겠어.

en: We might as well eat dog food as eat such a dish.
ko: 이런 걸 먹느니 차라리 개밥을 먹겠다.

en: He must be crazy to go out in this stormy weather.
ko: 이런 폭풍우 속에 나가다니 걔 제정신이 아닌 게 분명해.

en: I cannot entertain such a request.
What did they add this needless function for?
ko: 이 쓸데없는 기능을 왜 넣은 거야?

en: Hey! I don't want any crank calls - not at this hour.
ko: 야! 이 시간에 장난 전화 하지 마.

en: It is not safe for a girl to go out by herself so late at night.
ko: 밤늦게 여자애가 혼자 나가는 건 위험해.

en: What is the good of reading such books?
ko: 이런 책을 읽는 게 다 무슨 소용이야?

en: It is no use reading such a book.
I've never tasted anything as unusual as this.
You were thoughtful to remember me in this way.
ko: 이렇게 마음 써서 나를 챙겨주다니 정말 고마워.

en: In this way, we waste a lot of time.
ko: 이런 식으로 하면 우리 시간 낭비 너무 심해.

en: Do it this way.
This is the way he treated me.
I can't put up with these insults.
ko: 이런 모욕은 더 이상 못 참아.

en: Never have I read so terrifying a novel as this.
Never have I seen such a beautiful sunset.
This is the prettiest sunset I have ever seen.
ko: 내가 본 노을 중에 이게 제일 예뻐.

en: Have you ever seen such a beautiful sunset?
ko: 너 이렇게 예쁜 노을 본 적 있어?

en: Do not read books in such a dim room.
ko: 이렇게 어두운 데서 책 읽지 마.

en: It's impossible to work in a room this dim.
ko: 이렇게 어두운 방에선 도저히 일 못 하겠어.

en: I don't feel like going out on such a day.
Who'd have thought this is how the pieces fit?
ko: 이게 이렇게 딱 맞아떨어질 줄 누가 알았겠어?

en: I'd rather stay home than go out in this weather.
ko: 이런 날씨에 나가느니 차라리 집에 있을래.

en: I have some doubts about his coming in this weather.
ko: 이런 날씨에 그 사람이 올지 좀 의문이네요.

en: I am sorry to have kept you waiting so long.
ko: 너무 오래 기다리게 해서 정말 죄송해요.

en: Please excuse me for calling you so early in the morning.
It may not be amiss to give this advice.
ko: 이런 조언을 해드리는 게 나쁠 것 같지는 않네요.

en: I can't afford to eat in such an expensive restaurant.
ko: 이렇게 비싼 식당에서 밥 먹을 형편이 안 돼요.

en: Such a man cannot be relied upon.
ko: 그런 사람은 믿을 게 못 돼요.

en: This warm weather is abnormal for February.
ko: 2월 치고는 날씨가 너무 따뜻한 게 이상하네요.

en: There's nothing to make such a fuss about.
I've never had such a large sum of money.
Such a big gift is a white elephant to us.
ko: 이렇게 큰 선물은 저희한테 오히려 짐이에요.

en: You needn't have bought such a large house.
ko: 이렇게 큰 집을 살 필요는 없었는데 말이죠.

en: It takes a lot of money to keep up such a big house.
ko: 이렇게 큰 집을 유지하려면 돈이 정말 많이 들어요.

en: I've never seen such a giant watermelon!
This is the largest temple that I've ever seen.
ko: 제가 지금까지 본 절 중에서 제일 커요.

en: How are you going to spend such a large amount of money?
We can not carry on conversation in such a noisy room.
ko: 이렇게 시끄러운 방에서는 대화를 할 수가 없어요.

en: You mustn't miss seeing this wonderful film.
ko: 이 멋진 영화는 꼭 보셔야 해요.

en: I've never been to such a nice party.
I never dreamed of there being such a quiet place.
ko: 이렇게 조용한 곳이 있을 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어요.

en: I didn't foresee this turn of events.
ko: 상황이 이렇게 될 줄은 미처 몰랐어요.

en: What on earth are you doing in such a lonely place?
ko: 도대체 이런 한적한 곳에서 뭐 하시는 거예요?

en: I'm ashamed to go out dressed like this.
Where on earth do you suppose she is going in the dead of night?
ko: 도대체 이 야밤에 그녀가 어디로 간다는 걸까요?

en: It is hard to get along on this small income.
ko: 이 적은 수입으로 꾸려나가기 참 힘드네요.

en: Let's stop this fruitless discussion.
I wanna get out of here!
You had better not walk around in such a place.
ko: 이런 곳은 돌아다니지 않는 게 좋아요.

en: This is a daily occurrence.
I can't stand being cooped up in this prison!
ko: 이 감옥 같은 곳에 갇혀 있는 거 더는 못 참겠어요!

en: Will I make it through?
It's about time we did away with this outdated law.
ko: 이제 이런 시대에 뒤떨어진 법은 없앨 때가 됐어요.

en: I think it strange that there is no one on the street at this time of the day.
ko: 이 시간에 거리에 사람이 아무도 없다는 게 참 이상하네요.

en: Where on earth can he have gone off to at this time of day?
ko: 도대체 이 시간에 그가 어디로 가버린 걸까요?

en: Such a judge should retire from his job before retirement age.
ko: 그런 판사는 정년이 되기 전에 물러나야 해요.

en: This is the worst thing that has ever happened to me!
You're crazy to buy such an expensive bike.
ko: 이렇게 비싼 자전거를 사다니 제정신이 아니네요.

en: I had no idea it would be such an expensive restaurant. I feel like I'm out of place.
ko: 이렇게 비싼 식당일 줄 몰랐어요. 여기 저랑 좀 안 어울리는 것 같아요.

en: You are an idiot to go out in this weather.
ko: 이런 날씨에 밖으로 나가다니 바보 같네요.

en: I'd never seen such expansive scenery.
ko: 이렇게 탁 트인 풍경은 처음 봤어요.

en: Never have I been so happy.
Don't let such a good opportunity go by.
Your parents are not to blame for such a result.
ko: 이런 결과가 나온 게 부모님 탓은 아니에요.

en: I want to move out of this cramped room as soon as I can.
ko: 하루빨리 이 좁은 방에서 이사 가고 싶어요.

en: I've never heard anything more dreadful.
ko: 이보다 더 끔찍한 얘기는 들어본 적이 없어요.

en: We should do away with this regulation.
Did you ever hear of such a strange custom?
ko: 이런 이상한 풍습 들어본 적 있어요?

en: Who doesn't know such a simple proverb?
ko: 이런 간단한 속담을 모르는 사람이 어디 있어요?

en: I can't drink such sweet stuff.
This is the coldest weather in ten years.
It's foolish for you to swim when it's this cold.
ko: 이렇게 추울 때 수영을 하는 건 바보 같은 짓이에요.

en: You'd better not go out in this cold weather.
ko: 이렇게 추운 날씨엔 안 나가는 게 좋아.

en: There is no going out on such a cold day.
ko: 이렇게 추운 날엔 도저히 못 나가지.

en: I would rather stay at home than go out on such a cold day.
ko: 이렇게 추운 날 나가느니 그냥 집에 있을래.

en: I don't like to go out without a coat on such a cold day.
ko: 이렇게 추운 날 코트도 안 입고 나가는 건 싫어.

en: I look for all the world like an athlete in this outfit, but the truth is I don't do any sports at all.
ko: 이 옷차림만 보면 영락없는 운동선수인데, 사실 운동은 하나도 안 해.

en: Pardon me for being in this dress.
Having this meeting isn't going to do the trick, is it?
ko: 이 회의한다고 뭐가 해결될 것 같지 않지?

en: I wouldn't dream of going on a picnic on such a rainy day.
ko: 이런 비 오는 날에 소풍이라니, 꿈도 못 꿔.

en: We have no chance against those top players.
ko: 저런 일류 선수들을 상대로는 승산이 없어.

en: I often stumble over something as I am blind as a bat in the dark.
ko: 난 밤눈이 어두워서 어두우면 자꾸 어디 걸려 넘어져.

en: What do you need sunglasses for in such a dark place?
ko: 이렇게 어두운 데서 선글라스는 왜 끼는 거야?

en: You had better not go out in this bad weather.
ko: 날씨도 안 좋은데 안 나가는 게 좋겠어.

en: There is no going out in this stormy weather.
ko: 이런 폭풍우 속엔 나갈 수가 없어.

en: I can't get by on such a small income.
I feel like playing golf on such a lovely day.
ko: 날씨가 이렇게 좋은데 골프나 치면 좋겠다.

en: You cannot expect such a good chance again.
ko: 이런 좋은 기회는 다시 안 올 거야.

en: It's absolutely impossible for me to go on like this.
ko: 이런 식으론 도저히 계속 못 하겠어.

en: I should not have bought such a thing.
I am glad I did not buy such a thing.
ko: 이런 거 안 사길 정말 잘했다.

en: I can do without this.
"Put this stuff away at once!" she yelled in a rage.
ko: "이것들 당장 치워!" 그녀가 화가 나서 소리 질렀어.

en: I've botched things up so bad I wish I could find a hole to climb into.
ko: 일을 너무 망쳐놔서 쥐구멍에라도 숨고 싶어.

en: It's so odd talking in the dark like this.
I have a strong objection to being treated like this.
ko: 이런 대접 받는 건 정말 싫어.

en: This is the way in which it happened.
This is how they catch an elephant alive.
ko: 코끼리를 산 채로 잡을 땐 이렇게 해.

en: This is how I made it.
This is how I solved the difficult problem.
This is how we reached the conclusion.
This is the way in which we can become acquainted with one another.
ko: 이렇게 하면 우리 서로 친해질 수 있어.

en: I would rather die than have such a terrible experience.
ko: 그런 끔찍한 경험을 하느니 차라리 죽는 게 나아.

en: Mother told me that I had better not go out in such bad weather.
ko: 엄마가 날씨도 안 좋은데 나가지 말라고 하셨어.

en: I'm ashamed to ask you such a silly question.
ko: 이런 바보 같은 질문을 하려니 좀 부끄럽네.

en: I hope it will be the only one.
I've never seen anything like this before.
Never have I seen such a peaceful scene.
I'm sorry to cause you all this trouble.
I have seldom seen such a beautiful sunset as this.
ko: 이렇게 예쁜 노을은 본 적이 거의 없어.

en: Never have I seen such a beautiful sight.
Never have I seen such a beautiful picture.
I'm sorry to have kept you waiting so long.
I must apologize for not having written for such a long time.
I've never seen a pearl of such magnitude!
How can I work with all these papers everywhere?
ko: 서류가 사방에 널려 있는데 일을 어떻게 해?

en: More people came to the party than I had bargained for.
ko: 생각했던 것보다 사람들이 훨씬 많이 왔어.

en: Jobs are hard to come by with so many people out of work.
ko: 실업자가 너무 많아서 일자리 구하기가 힘들어.

en: Anyone would find it hard to run on such a hot day.
ko: 이렇게 더운 날 뛰는 건 누구라도 힘들 거야.

en: This intense heat doesn't seem to bother you.
ko: 넌 이 무더위도 아무렇지 않은가 봐.

en: How am I to pay such a debt?
There is no going out on such a stormy day.
ko: 이런 폭풍우 치는 날엔 나갈 수가 없어.

en: With it raining like this, we'll never be able to leave.
ko: 비가 이렇게 오는데, 절대로 못 나가지.

en: Death is preferable to such suffering.
ko: 이런 고통을 겪느니 차라리 죽는 게 나아.

en: This is the first time I've seen such a dreadful movie.
I haven't had such a good time in years.
ko: 몇 년 만에 이렇게 즐거운 시간은 처음이야.

en: It's convenient living so close to the station.
ko: 역이랑 이렇게 가까이 사니까 진짜 편하다.

en: This pen is a real bargain at such a low price.
ko: 이 펜, 이 가격이면 진짜 거저다.

en: You should not climb the mountain in such bad weather.
ko: 날씨가 이렇게 안 좋은데 산에 가면 안 돼.

en: This is the most exciting book that I have ever read.
ko: 내가 읽은 책 중에 이게 제일 재밌어.

en: I had no idea it'd be this beautiful.
It is bad of me to have kept you waiting so long.
ko: 이렇게 오래 기다리게 해서 정말 미안해.

en: You have all these books!
I'm really glad to have had such an enjoyable time.
ko: 이렇게 즐거운 시간을 보내서 정말 기뻐.

en: What a good scholar the author must be to write such a splendid book!
ko: 이런 대단한 책을 쓰다니 작가가 정말 훌륭한 학자인가 봐!

en: You mustn't miss such a good opportunity.
ko: 이런 좋은 기회를 놓치면 안 돼.

en: I'm really happy to have had such a great time.
ko: 이렇게 좋은 시간을 보내서 정말 행복해.

en: I'm sorry to trouble you so much.
I had no idea it would put you to so much trouble.
ko: 너한테 이렇게까지 폐가 될 줄은 몰랐어.

en: She must be kind-hearted to send you such a pretty doll.
ko: 이렇게 예쁜 인형을 보내주다니 그녀는 마음씨가 참 고운가 봐.

en: Never have I read such an interesting story.
ko: 이렇게 재미있는 이야기는 처음 읽어 봐.

en: I've never eaten anything as delicious as this.
ko: 이렇게 맛있는 건 처음 먹어 봐.

en: Have you ever listened to such a good music?
ko: 이렇게 좋은 노래 들어본 적 있어?

en: You had better not wander around here by yourself.
ko: 여기서 혼자 돌아다니지 않는 게 좋아.

en: I never expected this fine hotel to be found in such a place.
ko: 이런 곳에 이렇게 좋은 호텔이 있을 줄은 몰랐네.

en: Fancy meeting you here!
Never did I dream that I would meet you here.
ko: 너를 여기서 만날 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: Fancy meeting you here.
He said he wanted to put an end to such a trifle.
ko: 그는 이런 사소한 일은 이제 끝내고 싶대.

en: I'm sick of this hand-to-mouth existence.
ko: 하루 벌어 하루 사는 것도 이제 지긋지긋해.

en: I never saw such a splendid sunset.
Who wants to be cooped up indoors on a nice day like this?
ko: 이렇게 날씨 좋은 날에 누가 안에만 있고 싶겠어?

en: I hope this fine weather holds.
You must not miss seeing this wonderful film.
ko: 이 멋진 영화는 꼭 봐야 해.

en: Did you ever see such a film?
I've never seen a shot like that.
It is very kind of you to send me such a nice present.
ko: 이렇게 좋은 선물을 보내주다니 정말 고마워.

en: You may not believe this, but I don't drink at all.
ko: 안 믿길지도 모르겠지만, 나 술 아예 안 마셔.

en: This is the first time.
He must be stupid to believe such a thing.
ko: 그런 걸 믿다니 걔도 참 바보 같아.

en: Have you ever heard of such a thing?
He must be a fool to do such a thing.
ko: 그런 짓을 하다니 걔도 참 멍청해.

en: It was foolish of him to do such a thing.
ko: 그런 짓을 하다니 걔도 참 어리석었지.

en: Will you give me your reasons for doing this?
Please accept what little comfort these words can give you.
ko: 내 말이 조금이나마 위로가 됐으면 좋겠어.

en: You might not believe what I'm about to tell you, so don't be surprised.
ko: 지금 하려는 말 안 믿길 수도 있는데, 놀라지 마.

en: This is totally unacceptable.
I never thought it would wind up like this.
I'm sorry it worked out this way.
See to it that this never happens again.
Such a thing can't happen in Japan.
ko: 일본에서는 그런 일이 일어날 수 없어.

en: Even this cable cost me 6000 yen.
I don't dare ask such a silly question.
ko: 그런 바보 같은 질문은 차마 못 하겠어.

en: It is criminal to pay so much money for such trifles.
ko: 이런 사소한 거에 그렇게 큰돈을 쓰는 건 진짜 범죄 수준이야.

en: Never did I see such a beautiful sunset.
ko: 이렇게 아름다운 노을은 정말 처음 봐.

en: I can't stand an awful sweat like this.
ko: 이렇게 땀을 흘리는 건 도저히 못 참겠어.

en: Such playfulness is characteristic of Mr Baker.
Have you ever tasted such a good soup?
ko: 이렇게 맛있는 수프 먹어본 적 있어?

en: Such treatment would make anybody rebel.
ko: 그런 대우를 받으면 누구라도 반발할 거야.

en: It's a pity for you to have to stay indoors in this weather.
ko: 이런 날씨에 실내에만 있어야 한다니 정말 안타깝다.

en: Condors have never bred in zoos.
ko: 콘도르는 동물원에서 번식한 적이 한 번도 없어.

en: Whose turn is it next?
This time I'll try it.
I am to visit my uncle in Shizuoka next Sunday.
ko: 다음 주 일요일에 시즈오카에 있는 삼촌 댁에 가기로 했어.

en: What are you going to do next Sunday?
You must put up with your new post for the present.
ko: 당분간은 지금 맡은 일을 참고 견뎌야 해.

en: Prizes will be awarded at the end of the contest.
